refsect1.title: Running xboxdrv via xboxdrv-daemon
refsect1.para: xboxdrv-daemon allows you to run xboxdrv automatically whenever you plug in a gamepad. Since xboxdrv-daemon.py needs to know where xboxdrv is located you need to supply the location of the xboxdrv binary manually if its not located in PATH:
You can pass arguments to xboxdrv after a double dash '--':
You can also run scripts that get started after xboxdrv is started via:
This is useful in Kiosk settings, such as a media center PC, where you might want to restart the media center to have the controller working properly after it got attached.
Note that you lose some of the configurabilty when you launch it automatically via the daemon, so this isn't generally recomment.
When you want configurability and automatic launching, it is recomment that you write little startup scripts for your games, such as this:
refsect1.programlisting:
#!/bin/sh
# Start xboxdrv and remember its PID in the variable XBOXPID xboxdrv --trigger-as-button -s & XBOXPID=$!
# Give xboxdrv a second to startup and create the device sleep 1
# Launch your favorite game your_favorite_game
# Kill xboxdrv and wait for it to finish kill $XBOXPID wait $XBOXPID
# EOF #
refsect1.para: That way you can individually configure every game and still not have to worry about launching xboxdrv manually.
